file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-32-07-04 - CONFIG-2 - RINSE NIPPLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RINSE NIPPLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the rinse nipple. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-07-000-802-A RINSE NIPPLE - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-07-400-802-A RINSE NIPPLE - INSTALLATION EMB-135 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 38-32-07 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-07-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. RINSE NIPPLE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for removal of the rinse nipple. (2) To get access to the rinse nipple, you must open the waste service panel door and remove the baggage-compartment floor lining and floor panel 272AF. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193MR Rear wing-to-fuselage fairing 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the baggage compartment floor 1 Helps with the task Outside the aircraft I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-008-A (1) Open waste-service panel door 193MR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Remove the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-07 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-008-A (1) Through the baggage compartment floor, get access to the clamp (1) that attaches the rinse nipple (2) to the lower part of the flush tube, and loosen the clamp. (2) Remove the flush tube from the rinse nipple (2). (3) Remove the protective cap (5) from the rinse nipple (2). (4) Remove the screws (4) and washers (3) from the rinse nipple (2). (5) Remove the rinse nipple (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-07 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 Rinse Nipple - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 162 B 1. CLAMP ZONE 193 2. RINSE NIPPLE DET. A 2. RINSE NIPPLE DET. B 3. WASHER WASTE SERVICE PANEL 4. SCREW 5. PROTECTIVE CAP 145AMM380021.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-07 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-07-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. RINSE NIPPLE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for installation of the rinse nipple. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400 STALLATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193MR Rear wing-to-fuselage fairing 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the baggage compartment floor 1 Helps with the task Outside the aircraft I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-008-A (1) Put the rinse nipple (2) in its installation position and connect it to the lower part of the flush tube. (2) Attach the flush tube to the rinse nipple (2) with the clamp (1). (3) Install the screws (4) and the washers (3) that attach the rinse nipple (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-07 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Install the protective cap (5) on the rinse nipple (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-008-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (2) Install baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Install the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400). (4) Close waste-service panel door 193MR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-07 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
